info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 04 at 8:21PM CDT until November 04 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SCOTT...NORTHERN POLK...SOUTHWESTERN YELL AND NORTHERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 821 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located near Opal, or 16 miles east of Mena, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Mena... Hatfield... Oden... Opal... Mimosa... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Cossatot River State Park... Polk County Fairgrounds... Mena Intermountain Airport... Mccauley... Shady... Hartley... Bard Springs Recreation Area... Caney Creek Wilderness... Mauldin... Muddy Creek WMA... Acorn... Big Fork... Board Camp... Olio... TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
